Message.Title: A company with such facts is extreme undervalued: with only 36 million like today
Message.Msg: Fiscal 2013 Financial Guidance of Local Corp: Revenue - The company expects 2013 revenue of between $93 million and $95 million, which at the mid-point, is an increase of 12 percent, over the fourth quarter 2012 exit run rate. Adjusted Net Income – Adjusted Net Income for 2013 is expected to be at least $5 million, which would result in approximately $1 million in debt-free cash flow. The company defines debt-free cash flow as cash provided by operating activities, less capital expenditures

Topic.Title: EBAY RAISING FEES AGAIN UNDER GUISE OF LOWERING THEM

Message.Msg: back to hate. He did NOT raise my limit to 200 per month as he said he would. Guess he figured if he told me it would take about 5 minutes to update the account he would get me off the phone, and I would not waste another 2 hours calling again. He was right about that.

I see you have quit a sense of humor. I see you clearly see our daily (12 years and counting) ebay board troll. Can you imagine a clown that lives like this while his bank account is locked and his own neglected daughter and gran baby is kept away from him by law? Not funny in John's world.

Topic.Title: Good Morning From Always Sunny Philadelphia. I Hope That Helps.

Message.Msg: Better take another look at that weather forecast. Looks like rain is a coming. . .

Topic.Title: EBAY RAISING FEES AGAIN UNDER GUISE OF LOWERING THEM

Message.Msg: This is simply untrue. Ebay is not raising any fees at all. Just simplifying them. Not all sellers will see the same decreases or increases. Each seller's sales are unique and some will see decreases in their fees and some will see increases, but the vast majority of Ebay sellers will see a decrease in their overall fees. The feedback that we have received from our sellers about the new fee stucture has been overwhelmingly positive.

Topic.Title: 128% fee increase. If they don't reverse this increase they will lose my $1500 a month

Message.Msg: Stating that your overall fees will go up is simply untrue. You may pay a very slightly higher fee on some of your items, but overall your total fees will decrease because your listing fees will decrease. If you contact us, we can run your actual business results in a model that takes into account the store subscriptions, final value fees, and the insertion costs and show you how your actual sales would have played out in the new fee structure. You will see that your overall fees will decrease, just as they will for just about every Ebay seller.
The report says I have AIDS

Topic.Title: 128% fee increase. If they don't reverse this increase they will lose my $1500 a month

Message.Msg: You are a liar and an idiot or both. There is no way my overall fees will go down. The current fee for a $2,200 item is $62.50 for the first $1000 and 2% for the amount over $1000. That means 6.25 percent for the first $1000 and 2 percent for the rest. How can 9 percent for the entire amount be less. Oh yes, the listing fee. That is currently 50 cents. Is the new listing fee going to be negative $112? That is the only way that I would even break even.

Topic.Title: EBAY RAISING FEES AGAIN UNDER GUISE OF LOWERING THEM

Message.Msg: How can the vast majority of sellers see a fee decrease. Only sellers selling large quantities of cheap items will see a decrease. Anyone selling items for more than $80 will see a fee increase, and the fee increase percentage goes up with the price until the sale price is $2,778. It is simple math, which ebay thinks its customers are not capable of doing. Everything sold for between $80 and $2,778 will see a fee increase. A big one.
